FM: 48911 | coordinates = {{coord|41|40|28.00|N|85|56|51.00|W|region:US_type:city|display=inline}} | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = FM: [[WAOR]], WNIL-FM | affiliations = [[Fox News]] | owner = Federated Media | licensee = Pathfinder Communications Corporation | sister_stations = | webcast = | website = [http://www.michiananewschannel.com/ michiananewschannel.com] }} '''WTRC''' AM and FM are [[radio station]]s broadcasting a [[News Talk]] format. Commonly branded as "News Talk 95.3 MNC," WTRC broadcasts on 95.3 FM in [[Niles, Michigan]] and on 1340 AM in [[Elkhart, Indiana]]. WTRC is currently owned by Federated Media. WTRC carries a live-and-local morning show hosted by Matt Patrick, in addition to top talk hosts [[The Glenn Beck Program|Glenn Beck]], [[The Rush Limbaugh Show|Rush Limbaugh]] and [[The Sean Hannity Show|Sean Hannity]]. WTRC is also a [[Fox News Radio]] affiliate.{{cite news|url=http://www.southbendtribune.com/article/20100414/Biz/100419716/1129/News|title=Michiana radio stations to see talk shows, program formats shifting|last=Meenan|first=Jim|date=April 14, 2010|work=[[South Bend Tribune]]|accessdate=April 16, 2010}} ==History== Prior to switching to a [[News Talk]] format on May 10, 2010, AM 1340 WTRC briefly aired an [[oldies]]/[[classic rock|Classic Rock]] format as "Hippie Radio 1340",{{cite web |url=http://www.arbitron.com |date=Winter 2010 |title=Station Information Profile |publisher=[[Arbitron]] |accessdate=2010-02-20}} and featured programing from [[Citadel Media]] and [[Dial Global]].{{cite web |url=http://www.fcc.gov/fcc-bin/fmq?call=WTRC |title=WTRC Facility Record |work=United States [[Federal Communications Commission]], audio division |accessdate=2010-02-20}} Before becoming "Hippie Radio 1340" in August 2009, WTRC 1340 had a similar News/Talk format as "News Radio 1340".[http://www.etruth.com/Know/News/Story.aspx?id=490585 WTRC tunes in to music] ''ETruth.com'' August 15, 2009. Accessed May 14, 2010 Before adopting the current format 95.3 FM had a [[Classic rock]] format as [[WAOR]]. Following the change in formats WAOR moved, along with the Classic Rock format, up the dial to 95.7 FM. [http://www.southbendtribune.com/article/20100415/Biz/4150412/-1/XML Local radio to see changes] Meenan, Jim. ''[[South Bend Tribune]]''. April 15, 2010.
